purpleculture_pinyin:
zhuāng
stump; stake; pile; classifier for items
пень; ставка; куча; классификатор предметов
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 桩)
Pictophonetic: 舂 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 舂 [ chōng ] to grind in a mortar
heisig_chinese_memo: The new bonsai mortar is made from bonsai trees and is a high stakes investment at the moment since they haven't started selling yet.
Ru_trainchinese: zhuāng: (сущ/сч.слово) столб, кол, свая; счетное слово для дел и событий
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Such a moral person, Hamlet walks around attaching ropes to the ground with stakes so trees that need it can get some support.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " wood " and " chump ", the original meaning is wooden prongs, and it also refers to piles wedged into the ground. "Shuowen": "Yuyao. From the wood, the sound of pounding." Tang Libai's "Big Hunting Fu": "Go down the high stalks, level down the dangerous valleys, place the piles of the stalks, open the forest." Wang Qi's note: "Pile , Ye Ye."

" Pile " can be expressed as an internal warehouse for storing spare items, because " pile " also refers to storage and reserve. Song Yueke's "Land History-Great Random Commentary Book": "If you get one to two thousand silver silks, the money is one to two hundred thousand, and the stake is in Fengzhou. If you have this reward, you will not be destroyed."

At that time, the gambling chief called sitting bank, or pile. The third fold of Yuan Guan Hanqing's "Xie Tianxiang": "I put this color number in the dice bowl lightly...I can just do three tricks."

" Pile " is also used as a quantifier to indicate pieces and cases. Song Chenliang, "Hey the bridegroom. Reward Xin Youan, see you in rhyme again with rhyme": "Zhanxin is exchanged for the flag and farewell. Disassemble and close up the great righteousness of the time."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " wood " and " chump ", the original meaning is wooden prongs, and it also refers to piles wedged into the ground.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「舂」聲，本義為木橛，也泛指楔入地中的樁柱。《說文》：「橛杙也。从木，舂聲。」 唐李白〈大獵賦〉：「下整高穨，深平險谷，擺樁栝，開林叢。」王琦注：「樁，杙也。」

　　「樁」可表示為儲存備用物的內庫，因亦以「樁」指存儲、儲備。宋岳珂《桯史‧大散論賞書》：「若得銀絹一二萬匹兩，錢引一二十萬，樁在鳳州，有此重賞而虜不破滅無有也。」

　　時賭博頭家稱坐莊，或稱做樁。元關漢卿《謝天香》第三摺：「我將這色數兒輕放在骰盆內……我可便做樁兒三箇五。」

　　「樁」也用作量詞，表示件、宗。宋陳亮〈賀新郎‧酬辛幼安再用韻見寄〉：「斬新換出旗麾別。把當時、一樁大義，拆開收合。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「舂」聲，本義為木橛，也泛指楔入地中的樁柱。

(Simplified: 桩)
Pictophonetic: 舂 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
Chinese: The new bonsai mortar is made from bonsai trees and is a high stakes investment at the moment since they haven't started selling yet.
Meaning: stake
Hanzi: 桩
Story: Such a moral person, Hamlet walks around attaching ropes to the ground with stakes so trees that need it can get some support.
Kind: traditional

從「 木 」，「 舂 」聲，本義為木橛，也泛指楔入地中的樁柱。《說文》：「橛杙也。从木，舂聲。」 唐李白〈大獵賦〉：「下整高穨，深平險谷，擺樁栝，開林叢。」王琦注：「樁，杙也。」 「 樁 」可表示為儲存備用物的內庫，因亦以「 樁 」指存儲、儲備。宋岳珂《桯史‧大散論賞書》：「若得銀絹一二萬匹兩，錢引一二十萬，樁在鳳州，有此重賞而虜不破滅無有也。」 時賭博頭家稱坐莊，或稱做樁。元關漢卿《謝天香》第三摺：「我將這色數兒輕放在骰盆內……我可便做樁兒三箇五。」 「 樁 」也用作量詞，表示件、宗。宋陳亮〈賀新郎‧酬辛幼安再用韻見寄〉：「斬新換出旗麾別。把當時、一樁大義，拆開收合。」
From the sound of " wood" and " chump", the original meaning is wooden prongs, and it also refers to piles wedged into the ground. "Shuowen": "Yuyao. From the wood, the sound of pounding." Tang Libai's "Big Hunting Fu": "Go down the high stalks, level down the dangerous valleys, place the piles of the stalks, open the forest." Wang Qi's note: "Pile , Ye Ye." " Pile" can be expressed as an internal warehouse for storing spare items, because " pile" also refers to storage and reserve. Song Yueke's "Land History-Great Random Commentary Book": "If you get one to two thousand silver silks, the money is one to two hundred thousand, and the stake is in Fengzhou. If you have this reward, you will not be destroyed." At that time, the gambling chief called sitting bank, or pile. The third fold of Yuan Guan Hanqing's "Xie Tianxiang": "I put this color number in the dice bowl lightly...I can just do three tricks." " Pile" is also used as a quantifier to indicate pieces and cases. Song Chenliang, "Hey the bridegroom. Reward Xin Youan, see you in rhyme again with rhyme": "Zhanxin is exchanged for the flag and farewell. Disassemble and close up the great righteousness of the time."
